title: Projecting the 2026 NFL draft, one year out: Miller's early predictions for every Round 1 pick
content: What might the Browns and Rams do with their first-rounders? How many QBs could go on Day 1? Here's Matt Miller's early look at the 2026 draft.

title: Sources: Ayton to become free agent after buyout
content: Deandre Ayton is finalizing a contract buyout with the Portland Trail Blazers to become a free agent, sources told ESPN.

title: BYU QB Retzlaff intends to transfer, sources say
content: Jake Retzlaff, who is facing a suspension after admitting to premarital sex during his response to a lawsuit alleging he raped a woman, is planning to transfer, sources said.

title: Sources: Rockets' Smith to sign $122M extension
content: Rockets forward Jabari Smith Jr. intends to sign a five-year, $122 million rookie contract extension, sources told ESPN.

title: Freese saves 3 in USMNT win: 'Penalties my thing'
content: United States goalkeeper Matthew Freese said he was well prepared and studied up on penalties after providing three saves in a dramatic 4-3 shootout victory over Costa Rica in Sunday's Gold Cup quarterfinal.

title: Sky's Reese sets WNBA rebound mark in victory
content: The Sky's Angel Reese scored a season-high 24 points and became the first WNBA player with 15 or more rebounds in four straight games in a 92-85 win over the Sparks on Sunday.

title: Bailey 'blessed' to be with Jazz: 'Trust my process'
content: Ace Bailey indicated Sunday that he never thought about holding out or forcing a trade after the Jazz drafted him No. 5.

title: Sources: Harden to sign $81.5M deal with Clips
content: James Harden is declining his $36.3 million player option and intends to sign a two-year, $81.5 million contract to return to the Clippers, sources told ESPN.

title: Source: Knights clear space, deal Hague to Preds
content: The Vegas Golden Knights, perhaps opening cap room to take a run at Mitch Marner, dealt defenseman Nicolas Hague to the Nashville Predators on Sunday, in exchange for blueliner Jeremy Lauzon and center Colton Sissons, a source confirmed.

title: NBA insiders: What we're hearing about 20 teams hours before free agency begins
content: Free agency begins at 6 p.m. ET. Here are the latest rumblings from across the league, from potential free agent targets to trades. Watch the 'NBA Today Free Agency Special' at 7 p.m. ET on ESPN.

title: Experts weigh in: Can Alcaraz and Gauff win another major? What about Djokovic?
content: Just three weeks after the last Grand Slam, Wimbledon begins on Monday. Our experts answer these questions and more.

title: Freese saves the day as USMNT grinds out another Gold Cup victory
content: It wasn't pretty, but USMNT has marched into the Gold Cup semifinals thanks to Matt Freese's heroics in goal.

title: Winning the offseason? Here are the biggest surprise players on each NFL team
content: Some are fighting for starting spots while others are battling for key depth roles. Here's who have made an early impression.

title: A new kind of MLB mock draft: Our insiders make the picks for all 30 teams -- with trades!
content: Blockbuster trades, trash talk and high-risk picks. ESPN's experts team up for the mock draft you didn't know you needed.

title: Complete draft order of picks for every round
content: When does your favorite team pick in every round of the draft? Here's a pick-by-pick look at all 20 rounds.

title: NHL free agency preview: How each team can earn an A+
content: With the market set to open Tuesday, we identify key free agents for each club -- and what each GM should do.

title: Is Jake Paul ready for a world title fight? Who is his best option?
content: Following his victory over Julio Cesar Chavez Jr., Jake Paul called out the cruiserweight champs. But can he get them in the ring?

title: Caitlin Clark's status, 3-pointers and fast-break points: Keys to Tuesday's Commissioner's Cup final
content: Minnesota has set the bar for consistency this season. Indiana? Not so much. And Caitlin Clark's status is uncertain.

title: Fight grades: UFC 317 was the best pay-per-view of 2025
content: UFC 317 gets the best report card of the year so far. It was all-around entertaining and included one near-perfect fight.

title: Not even Messi can bridge gap between UCL champs PSG and MLS' Inter Miami
content: At times, Lionel Messi has singlehandedly carried Inter Miami to victory. Against the European champions PSG, the Herons needed more than that.

title: PSG rout ends CWC run for Inter Miami, Messi
content: Joao Neves scored twice as Paris Saint-Germain swept aside Lionel Messi's Inter Miami CF 4-0 at Atlanta's Mercedes-Benz Stadium on Sunday to secure their place in the Club World Cup quarterfinals with ruthless efficiency.

title: Sources: Chelsea agree $82M deal for João Pedro
content: Chelsea have agreed a deal worth a total of £60 million for Brighton striker Joao Pedro, sources have told ESPN.

title: Messi: Miami 'left a good image' despite CWC exit
content: Inter Miami CF left-back Jordi Alba said the team lived up to the expectations of the Club World Cup despite falling 4-0 to Paris Saint-Germain in the round of 16 to be eliminated from the competition.

title: England rout Jamaica 7-0 in Euro 2025 send-off
content: England eased past Jamaica 7-0 on Sunday to give themselves a winning send off as they head to Switzerland for Euro 2025 looking to defend their crown.

title: 'It's a joke': Maresca slams CWC weather delays
content: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca questioned the choice of the U.S. as host of the Club World Cup and branded the two-hour weather delay in his team's win over Benfica as "a joke."

title: Mexico into Gold Cup semis as Mora makes history
content: Alexis Vega scored the crucial opening goal early in the second half to help Mexico to a 2-0 win over Saudi Arabia in the Gold Cup quarterfinals.

title: Bonmati out of hospital; to rejoin Spain squad
content: Spain striker Aitana Bonmatí has been discharged from hospital after recovering from viral meningitis and will re-join the squad in the coming days.

title: Sources: Chelsea agree to sign Gittens; 7-yr deal
content: Chelsea have agreed a deal worth up to €65 million ($76.1m) to sign Jamie Gittens from Borussia Dortmund, sources have told ESPN.

title: Breaking down the best and worst of the NBA draft
content: Who was the steal of the draft? Which teams made risky moves? Our experts share their postdraft superlatives.

title: Best power half-seasons ever: Where Cal Raleigh and Aaron Judge rank -- and whether they can keep it up
content: Two AL hitters are crushing long balls at a historic rate. Before their 81st games, we compare their first-half performances to the best ever -- and whether they can keep it going.

title: Power Rankings: A new No. 1 and a top-5 debut
content: The Mets falling as their slump continues and the Astros notching their highest ranking of the season.

title: Pep: CWC 'not ideal,' but other clubs jealous
content: Pep Guardiola has accepted that participation in the FIFA Club World Cup could "destroy" Manchester City's season but has hinted that other clubs not in the tournament are jealous they are not taking part.

title: Guatemala dumps Canada in Gold Cup shootout
content: Jose Morales buried the winner in the seventh round of penalty kicks to propel Guatemala over Canada and into the semifinals of the Concacaf Gold Cup on Sunday in Minneapolis.

title: Only terrible agent can stop Gyökeres exit - chief
content: Sporting CP president Frederico Varandas has admitted that Viktor Gyökeres is likely to leave the club this summer.

title: Flamengo coach: 'Fact' Europe has 'better players'
content: Flamengo coach Filipe Luis said it was a "fact" the football elite remained in Europe after the Brazilian side were beaten 4-2 in a last-16 clash against Bayern Munich at the Club World Cup on Sunday.

title: 24 in 24: Rodriguez nets in another USWNT debut
content: Defender Izzy Rodriguez and midfielder Sam Meza were the two latest players to wear the USWNT shirt in a match for the first time under Hayes and Rodriguez scored.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool ready to offer player as part of Guéhi deal
content: Liverpool's pursuit of Guéhi could see one of their promising young attackers go the other way. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: S. Korean duo win Dow, deny Thompson title
content: Somi Lee poured in an 8-foot birdie putt on the first playoff hole to team with fellow South Korean Jin Hee Im to win the Dow Championship on Sunday, denying Lexi Thompson her first LPGA title in six years.

title: How Wiegman's 'new England' have evolved ahead of Euro 2025
content: England won Euro 2022 but have undergone some changes in the three years since. How are they looking ahead of their title defense?

title: India hardens stance on farm sector concessions as India-US trade talks stretch
content: India-US trade talks extend as the Indian government твердо stands firm on agricultural concessions, prioritizing the interests of its farmers. While the US seeks deals before reciprocal tariffs take effect, India is wary of one-sided agreements. Industry representatives have suggested compromise, but the government emphasizes a balanced outcome, with a limited initial deal and further tranches expected.

title: Denied visa, Pak couple crosses border for new life; perishes in Thar desert
content: A Pakistani couple, Ravi Kumar and Shanti Bai, who crossed the international border near Jaisalmer, tragically died of thirst and dehydration. Their bodies were discovered with an empty jerry can, highlighting their desperate struggle. Despite visa rejections and warnings, they sought a better life in India, leading them to cross illegally and become lost in the desert.

title: 3-language policy row: CM Devendra Fadnavis labels Uddhav Thackeray 'palturam'
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis criticized Uddhav Thackeray, labeling him "palturam" after reversing the three-language policy due to opposition pressure. Fadnavis clarified that the BJP-led government supports all national languages, including Hindi. He pointed out that Thackeray's own administration had previously mandated Hindi instruction based on the Raghunath Mashelkar Committee's recommendations.

title: Leadership issues: Firebrand Telangana BJP MLA Raja Singh resigns from party
content: Telangana BJP MLA T Raja Singh has resigned from the party, expressing his disappointment over reports suggesting Ramchander Rao's likely appointment as the state unit president. Singh stated the decision shocked him and countless party workers who have supported the BJP. He fears the leadership change will undermine grassroots efforts and jeopardize the party's chances in Telangana.

title: Amazon founder’s last minute text sends plane full of tequila to Venice
content: Venture capitalist Chamath Palihapitiya gifted Jeff Bezos a case of his ultra-premium tequila for his Venice wedding to Lauren Sánchez. Palihapitiya mentioned Bezos's last-minute request on X. The wedding, a lavish three-day affair reportedly costing $50 million, saw celebrity guests like Bill Gates and Kim Kardashian.

title: 'In North India, we're trained thugs': The harsh truth behind nation's North-South divide
content: Chess culture differs greatly between North and South India. Vantika Agrawal highlights the lack of recognition for chess players in the North. In contrast, Tamil Nadu provides strong support, including financial aid and flexible schooling. This fosters a competitive environment. The challenge is to create a unified chess community. This will allow talent from all regions to flourish equally.

title: National-level boxer alleges sexual harassment by woman coach; FIR filed
content: A minor female boxer has accused a coach at the Sports Authority of India of sexual harassment. The victim's parents reported mental and physical abuse. The Boxing Federation of India and SAI confirmed receiving a complaint. However, they denied sexual harassment allegations. An FIR was filed, and police are investigating.

title: Why Zohran Mamdani cannot become president of US
content: You get Zohran Mamdani — socialist state assemblyman, TikTok darling, heir to Mahmood Mamdani’s intellectual insurgency, and, in the fevered imaginations of brunch-table liberals, the Barack Obama of the algorithm age.

title: OpenAI is shutting down for the next week; CRO Mark Chen warns employees
content: OpenAI is temporarily closing down operations next week. This is to allow employees to rest after long work hours. Meta is trying to recruit OpenAI staff with high salary offers. Mark Chen warned OpenAI staff about Meta's tactics. Meta recently hired some OpenAI researchers. OpenAI is planning to change its compensation strategy.

title: 'Hope Bumrah teaches me some bowling skills': Neeraj gears up for NC Classic - Watch
content: Neeraj Chopra, India's Olympic champion, took a break from training for the Neeraj Chopra Classic to share insights and predictions in a candid chat. He humorously suggested Brett Lee could excel in javelin and expressed interest in learning bowling from Jasprit Bumrah. Chopra also admired Sachin Tendulkar's ability to handle pressure and seeks to emulate that calm mindset.

title: Gross GST collections hit record high of Rs 22.08 lakh crore in FY25
content: Gross Goods and Services Tax collections hit a record high of Rupees 22.08 lakh crore in fiscal year 2024-25. This is double Rs 11.37 lakh crore collected in fiscal year 2021.

title: No driver needed: Elon Musk on Tesla car delivering itself from factory to home; ‘There were no...’
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk announced the successful autonomous delivery of a Model Y, driving itself from the factory near Austin to a customer's home. Musk emphasized that the vehicle operated without any human intervention, either inside the car or through remote control, marking a significant milestone for Tesla's autonomous driving technology.

title: Himachal Pradesh rain update: IMD issues alert in 10 districts, including Shimla
content: Himachal Pradesh is under alert due to heavy monsoon rains. Ten districts are affected. Roads are blocked and power outages are occurring. The Shimla-Kalka railway is suspended. Landslides and rising river levels are reported. Tourists are warned to stay indoors. More rainfall is expected. Travellers are urged to postpone their visit. Authorities are working to restore essential services.

title: ‘Couldn’t take it anymore’: TN newly-wed woman dies by suicide after consuming sulphas
content: In Tirupur, a 27-year-old newlywed, Ridhanya, tragically committed suicide due to relentless dowry harassment. She consumed sulphas tablets en route to a temple, leaving behind a WhatsApp voice message detailing the abuse by her husband, Kavinkumar, and his parents. Ridhanya's family had provided a substantial dowry, but the demands persisted.

title: Congress ‘high command’: Who’s the boss? ‘A ghost,' says BJP
content: The BJP has criticized Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge's reference to the "high command" amid speculation about a leadership change in Karnataka. Tejasvi Surya likened the high command to a ghost, questioning who it is if not Kharge himself.

title: 'Stronger together': Dwyane Wade, Gabrielle Union on first-marriage mistakes
content: Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union, both previously married, have built a strong and enduring marriage. They attribute their success to learning from past mistakes, prioritizing open communication, and supporting each other's careers. Despite challenges, including a brief separation and Wade fathering a child with another woman, they've created a blended family and continue to thrive.

title: Kota shocker: Cop’s slap leaves shopkeeper unconscious
content: A shocking video circulating online shows a police officer in Kota, Rajasthan, allegedly slapping a shopkeeper unconscious after an argument over a parked bike. The NGO NCMIndia Council For Men Affairs shared the video, sparking outrage and accusations of police brutality. Social media users are demanding action against the officer, identified as SHO Pushpendra Bansiwal.

title: Mitch Marner bids emotional farewell as Maple Leafs brace for bold new era
content: Mitch Marner’s heartfelt farewell to the Toronto Maple Leafs signals a major turning point for the franchise, with his emotional exit interview and past-tense reflections. As free agency inches closer, Marner’s silence on staying and the team’s vague stance on contract talks make one thing clear, Toronto is preparing to move forward without him. The quiet farewell feels less like rumor and more like an accepted reality, with both player and franchise ready for a split.

title: ‘Littered with human waste’: Techie locks self in Navi Mumbai flat for 3 years
content: In Navi Mumbai, Anup Kumar Nair, a 55-year-old man, battled severe loneliness and depression, isolating himself in his flat for three years, relying solely on online food orders. Following a concerned tip, SEAL social workers intervened, discovering Nair in dire conditions, suffering from a leg infection and profound distrust after the loss of his family

title: New CM in Karnataka? Kharge's 'high command' hint as Sidda-DKS put up united front
content: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge hinted at a possible leadership change in Karnataka, stating the party high command has the power to act. Chief Minister Siddaramaiah dismissed rumors of discord with Deputy CM DK Shivakumar, affirming their government will remain stable for five years.

title: Gautam Gambhir takes a playful dig at Kapil Sharma when asked about ...
content: The Great Indian Kapil Show is set to deliver a laughter-filled episode. Indian cricketers Gautam Gambhir, Rishabh Pant, Abhishek Sharma, and Yuzvendra Chahal will grace the stage. Kapil Sharma's witty banter promises hilarious moments. Gambhir will share insights on his on-field intensity. Navjot Singh Sidhu's return adds a fresh twist.

title: Train horror: YouTuber alleges being drugged and robbed in 2AC coach
content: YouTuber Kanika Devrani reported being drugged and robbed on the Brahmaputra Mail while traveling alone from Delhi to Assam. She alleged an unauthorized man entered her 2AC coach, used a sedative, and stole her and another passenger's phones.

title: 'I did marry a farmer': Hailee Steinfeld wants to trade glam for a garden
content: Following their recent wedding and honeymoon, Hailee Steinfeld is expressing a desire for a simpler life. She dreams of living on a farm, growing vegetables, and raising chickens. This vision aligns with Josh Allen's upbringing on a 2,000-acre farm in California, potentially making their shared dream a reality despite their high-profile careers.

title: Delhi horror: Man stabs 10-year-old son to death; siblings witness murder
content: In a tragic incident in Delhi's Sagarpur, a 40-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly stabbing his 10-year-old son to death after the child insisted on playing in the rain. The father, a daily wage labourer, was living with his four children after his wife's death.

title: 'Maintain work-life balance’: Infosys to staff; Murthy had spoken of 70-hour work week
content: Infosys is actively promoting work-life balance among its employees. The IT giant is monitoring remote work hours and cautioning staff against extended periods, citing potential health concerns. Personalized emails are sent to employees exceeding the prescribed 9.15 hours a day, five days a week.

title: At least 12 killed in Telangana factory blast; robots deployed to douse flame
content: A devastating reactor blast at Sigachi Industries in Telangana's Pashamylaram has claimed the lives of at least 10 workers, with several others injured. The explosion triggered a massive fire, prompting a large-scale response from fire departments across the region.

title: Jeremy Swayman’s Florence wedding trip with girlfriend; Getaway stuns NHL fans
content: Boston Bruins goaltender Jeremy Swayman and his girlfriend Alessandra recently turned heads with their picturesque trip to Florence. The couple, attending a close friend's wedding, gave fans a personal peek into their stylish and intimate Italian weekend. Alessandra’s photo diary revealed scenic family moments and romantic snaps. Along with Swayman, and a flair for fashionable travel storytelling.

title: 'Broken bangles': Businessman, wife, daughter die by suicide in Lucknow
content: In Lucknow's Ashrafabad, a cloth merchant, Shobhit Rastogi, his wife Shuchita, and their daughter Khyati tragically died by suicide due to overwhelming debt. They were discovered unconscious in their flat, with police finding a suicide note citing severe financial stress. Shobhit's younger daughter alerted her uncle, who then informed the authorities.

title: 'China is living in the future': Drone airlifts man stuck in Guangxi floods - watch
content: During severe floods in Southern China, a man was trapped on a rooftop, inaccessible by rescue boats. His resourceful neighbor used his agricultural drone, typically used for heavy lifting, to create a makeshift harness. The drone successfully airlifted the man to safety, showcasing quick thinking in a crisis.

title: Kolkata rape case: Attack 'premeditated'; victim targeted from day one of admission
content: "The entire matter was premeditated. The trio had been plotting for several days to carry out this torture on the victim. We have found that the victim was targeted by the prime accused from the very first day she got admission to the college," the officer was quoted as saying by the news agency PTI.​​

title: New regional power bloc? Pakistan, China planning to replace SAARC
content: Pakistan and China are reportedly developing a proposal for a new regional organization, potentially replacing SAARC. Discussions have progressed significantly, emphasizing regional integration and connectivity. A recent meeting in Kunming included Pakistan, China, and Bangladesh, with plans to invite other former SAARC members, including India, Sri Lanka, Maldives and Afghanistan.

title: Post Op Sindoor, India to fast-track launch of 52 defence surveillance satellites
content: India is accelerating its space surveillance capabilities following Operation Sindoor, planning to launch 52 dedicated military satellites by 2029, with the first launch expected next April. This initiative, costing Rs 26,968 crore, aims to enhance surveillance of China, Pakistan, and the Indian Ocean Region. The move is also a response to China's growing space capabilities and military advancements in space.

title: Vibhanshu Dixit joins the cast of CID, says, "It was a childhood dream ..."
content: Vibhanshu Dixit, known for his role in Apollena – Sapno Ki Unchi Udann, is thrilled to fulfill his childhood dream by starring in CID. He expresses his excitement about working with the iconic cast, including Shivaji Satam and Aditya Srivastava.

title: 'Govt will last 5 years like a rock': CM Siddaramaiah asserts stability
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has firmly stated that his Congress government will complete its full five-year term, dismissing speculation about a leadership change. This declaration comes amidst internal murmurs and after a Congress leader hinted at potential political shifts.

title: 'Not offering Iran anything': Trump refuses to talk with Tehran
content: Donald Trump denies offering Iran any incentives for nuclear talks, contrasting his stance with Obama's JCPOA. This denial follows reports of potential US economic incentives in exchange for Iran halting uranium enrichment. Trump vehemently refuted these reports, labeling them as "fake news" and a "hoax," while tensions remain high after recent strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities.

title: 'If there's a loophole': Taylor Swift's dad may step in amid Lively-Baldoni legal mess
content: Taylor Swift is dealing with a legal situation involving Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni. Her father, Scott Swift, is reportedly exploring options to protect her. Travis Kelce is providing support. Taylor and Travis were recently seen at Tight Ends University in Nashville. They appeared happy and danced together. Sources suggest their relationship is serious and heading towards long-term commitment.

title: Bengaluru horror: Woman’s body found stuffed in bag inside garbage truck
content: A 34-year-old woman, suspected to be Pushpa, was found murdered and her body stuffed in a bag in Bengaluru. Police investigations revealed CCTV footage of a man transporting the body on a scooter.

title: Shefali Jariwala’s demise: What we know so far
content: Shefali Jariwala, the 'Kaanta Laga' star, tragically passed away at 42. Initial reports suggest cardiac arrest, but further details indicate a combination of factors, including fasting, stale food consumption, and long-term use of anti-ageing injections without medical supervision. Police found glutathione, vitamin C injections, and acidity pills at her home, raising concerns about self-medication.

title: Kannappa Box Office Collection: Vishnu Manchu's film sees Monday dip
content: Vishnu Manchu's Kannappa had a good opening weekend. The mythological drama saw a drop in collections on Monday. Early estimates show a collection of Rs 55 lakhs on Day 4. The film earned Rs 9.35 crore on Day 1. Vishnu Manchu credited Prabhas for the film's strong opening. The movie also stars Akshay Kumar, Kajal Aggarwal and Mohanlal.

title: GCC hiring: 40,000 jobs coming! Bengaluru, Hyderabad among top hubs
content: Mid-market global capability centres in India are projected to create 40,000 new jobs by 2026, expanding their workforce to over 260,000. Around 120 new centres, primarily in software, BFSI, and retail, are expected, driven by firms with $300M-$2B in revenue. Recruitment will target key talent hubs, focusing on AI/ML, data analytics, and cybersecurity roles.

title: Infiltration bid foiled in J&K: Army arrests Pak man leading Jaish terrorists
content: The army foiled a major infiltration attempt along the LoC, apprehending a Pakistani national, Mohammed Arif, acting as a guide for JeM terrorists. Arif, a resident of PoJK, was captured while leading four terrorists into Indian territory; however, the terrorists managed to escape back to Pakistan. Interrogation revealed Arif's collaboration with the Pakistani army in facilitating infiltration attempts.

title: Lawrence Bishnoi’s interview from lock-up: DSP 'spent Rs 2.6 cr but earned Rs 26 lakh'
content: Dismissed Punjab police DSP Gursher Singh Sandhu and his mother face a vigilance bureau case for allegedly possessing assets disproportionate to known income sources, linked to the controversial Lawrence Bishnoi interview. Investigations revealed Gursher spent nearly ten times his official income over three years.

title: Buying farm land to legitimise undisclosed funds? New ruling a big blow
content: Tax authorities are scrutinizing agricultural land transactions used to conceal unaccounted money. A recent ITAT verdict, addressing a tax evasion case, could disrupt this practice. The ITAT's interpretation of 'immovable assets' to include agricultural land may hinder money laundering through undervalued land purchases if endorsed by the High Court.

title: California blaze: Over 1k acres scorched by 'wolf fire'; evacuations ordered
content: A fast-moving brush fire, dubbed the Wolf fire, has consumed over 1,165 acres in Southern California, triggering mandatory evacuations. The blaze, reported near Wolfskill Truck Trail, is impacting Highway 243 and surrounding areas. It is one of five active fires across the Inland Empire, fueled by hot, dry conditions and strong winds, prompting red flag warnings.

title: DPL: Virat Kohli's nephew, Virender Sehwag's sons in auction list
content: Aaryaveer Kohli, nephew of Virat Kohli, and Aaryavir Sehwag, son of Virender Sehwag, are set to participate in the Delhi Premier League (DPL) auction. Aaryaveer Kohli, a leg-spinner, and Aaryavir Sehwag, along with his brother Vedant, feature in the draft, following their performances in Delhi's Under-16 and Under-19 teams.

title: Cockroach in Srisailam laddoo? Andhra temple investigating CCTV footage
content: A devotee at the Srisailam Devasthanam temple in Andhra Pradesh allegedly found a cockroach in a laddoo prasad, raising concerns about hygiene. While the devotee shared the incident online, temple authorities refuted the claim, asserting strict cleanliness during preparation. Despite the denial, a review of distribution and preparation areas has been initiated as a precaution.

title: 12 Killed In Massive Explosion, Fire At Chemical Factory In Telangana
content: Twelve workers were killed and about 30 others injured in a blast at an industrial unit in Pashamylaram near Hyderabad on Monday.

title: 4 Including Elderly Woman Shot Dead In Manipur's Churachandpur, Rivalry Between Kuki Militant Groups Suspected
content: Four people including a 60-year-old woman were shot dead by unidentified gunmen in Manipur's Churachandpur district today, the police said.

title: 2 Astronauts, 2 Prime Ministers, 1 India: A Cosmic Leap 41 Years Apart
content: Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla, speaking from the International Space Station (ISS), looked down upon the subcontinent and said, "Jab pehli baar Bharat ko dekha, Bharat sach mein bohat bhavya dikhta hain."

title: Exclusive: New Satellite Pics Show India's Attack Split Pak Terror Camps Into Half
content: During Operation Sindoor, India struck infrastructure sites linked to terror groups like Lashkar-e-Taiba, Jaish-e-Mohammed and Hizbul Mujahideen.

title: Scolded Over Excessive Phone Use, Madhya Pradesh Girl Fakes Own Kidnapping
content: Upset after being scolded by her mother for excessive mobile phone use, a 13-year-old girl in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur allegedly faked her own kidnapping and even demanded a ransom of Rs 15 lakh through a handwritten note, police said on Monday.

title: Pakistani Couple Found Dead In Rajasthan, Likely Died Of Dehydration
content: Two days after a young couple's bodies were found in Rajasthan, police have identified them as two Pakistan nationals who had fled to India and likely died of dehydration.

title: UP Toddler Falls In Boiling Pot, Dies; Similar Tragedy Struck Family 2 Years Ago
content: Tragedy repeated itself in a family here, eerily in a similar manner, after two years and claimed the life of a girl child on each occasion.

title: Industrial Output Growth Slows To 9-Month Low Of 1.2% In May
content: India's industrial production growth slowed to a nine-month low of 1.2 per cent in May 2025 due to poor performance of manufacturing, mining and power sectors caused by the early onset of monsoon, according to official data released.

title: Campus Neta, Lawyer, Rape Accused: Monojit 'Mango' Mishra's Chilling Tale
content: Monojit Mishra, the prime accused in the rape case in Kolkata, is an alumnus who wielded huge influence on the campus even after he passed out.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Who Wants Peace, Anyway? On War And The People Who Fuel It
content: The war industry cannibalises all others, and there's no shortage of hypocrisy in today's global security discourse. Powerful states lament instability while fuelling it through arms sales and proxy wars.

title: Telangana MLA T Raja Singh Quits BJP, Flags State Party Chief Choice
content: Controversial Telangana leader T Raja Singh, who has often made headlines for hate speech and communally-charged remarks, has resigned from the BJP

title: After Honeymoon Murder, This Meghalaya Region Has New Rule For Tourists
content: Meghalaya has made it mandatory for tourists to hire authorised and recognised guides while trekking in East Khasi Hills district for safety, the deputy commissioner and chairperson of the District Tourism Promotion Society said.

title: AIMIM To Join Team Opposition In Bihar Polls? What Asaduddin Owaisi Said
content: As the political temperature in Bihar rises months ahead of the Assembly polls, the NDA and the Opposition camp are holding frenetic negotiations over seat-sharing.

title: Today's Political Atmosphere Not Favourable For Indian Democracy: Jagdeep Dhankhar
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Monday expressed concern over the current political scenario in the country, saying today's political atmosphere is not favourable for Indian democracy and social health.

title: N. Ramchander Rao To Be New Telangana BJP Chief
content: Senior leader N. Ramchander Rao is likely to be appointed as the new President of Bharatiya Janata Party's (BJP) Telangana unit, party sources said.

title: Centre Plans To Utilise Indus Waters, Plans Public Outreach: Sources
content: The initiative aims to increase public awareness of how the suspension of the decades-old agreement benefits India.

title: Dalai Lama, A Resilient Advocate For The Tibetan People
content: The Dalai Lama, spiritual head of Tibetan Buddhism, has often called himself a simple monk, but for more than 60 years armed with little more than charm and conviction, he has managed to keep the cause of his people in the international spotlight

title: Sweet-Smelling Fungi At Centre Of Australian Triple-Murder Trial
content: The triple-murder trial of Australian Erin Patterson revolves around an innocuous-looking mushroom with a "slightly sweet" smell and a sinister name.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Story Of Raj Narain, Who Led To Indira Gandhi's Ouster, Then Return
content: The fall of two Prime Ministers, Indira Gandhi and Morarji Desai - as well as the (short-lived) anointment of a third, Chaudhary Charan Singh - is attributed to Narain.

title: Which teams' drafts get an A? What about a C-minus? We have grades for all 30
content: my team grades for the 2025 draft are the only ones you'll read that aren't concerned with results . no team, not even the Brooklyn Nets, drafts enough players in one year . trades are also considered .

title: Who's next for Ilia Topuria, Charles Oliveira, Alexandre Pantoja after UFC 317?
content: former featherweight champion Ilia Topuria knocked out former lightweight champion Charles Oliveira in the UFC 317 title fight . the men's flyweight division took center stage as topuria picked up knockout wins over Alexander Volkanovski and Max Holloway .

title: After a tough French Open, Naomi Osaka is optimistic about Wimbledon
content: Naomi Osaka lost first set to Paula Badosa at the french open last month . the 27-year-old struggled to speak in her news conference soon after . she apologized for cursing before sitting back in her chair .

title: Gunmen open fire on vehicle in Manipur: 4 killed, including elderly woman
content: the TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape . the toi news desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India .

title: From the favorites to the underdogs: Ranking the contenders
content: Jannik Sinner says parting ways with his trainer and physio before Wimbledon won't affect his play . in the past 20 years, only 12 players have reached the gentlemen's final . Roger Federer and Novak Djokovic accounted for more than half of those 40 spots in the finals .

title: Grading all 32 NHL draft classes: From one A-plus to multiple Ds
content: a team with three first-round picks might have a lower grade . the grade is weighted against the expectation of what teams could reasonably have done with their selections based on my model and team need . every team is getting a draft grade, regardless of how many players they selected .

title: Seven underrated NBA free agents -- and teams that should sign them
content: the top five free agents in ESPN's rankings are All-Stars . they've all exercised a player option or already agreed to new contract terms with their current teams . there are seven free agents worth targeting as the frenzy begins this week .

title: Al Hilal keen to show their level vs. Man City at Club World Cup
content: new al Hilal coach Simone Inzaghi says the tournament is so important for his team . inzaghi believes pep Guardiola will be happy with his team after a goalless draw against FC Salzburg . he says he's not coming here just to be in the group of the best in the world .

title: Toddler dies after falling into boiling pot in UP, sister died same way 2 years ago
content: the TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: 👀 Cap room, best free agents for every NBA team
content: teams across the league are shifting focus to the free agency and trade landscape . how many teams have salary cap space, and which could create some? who could follow the Boston Celtics and make cost-cutting trades to save on their luxury tax bill?

title: Transfer window: What do Europe's big clubs still need?
content: the transfer window has been a bit different this year thanks to the FIFA Club World Cup . but international deals will be officially going through in the premier league , german Bundesliga , French Ligue 1 , Spanish LaLiga and Italian Serie A on July 1 . we asked our ESPN reporters to assess the business still needing to happen .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: Austria could be a turning point for Norris' F1 title charge
content: a 1-2 finish at the Austrian Grand Prix with Lando Norris finishing first and Oscar Piastri in second . the victory provided a succinct answer to his critics . norris has shifted a title narrative that appeared ready to write him off following his disastrous Canadian Grand Prix .

title: As it happened: Jake Paul dominates, defeats Julio Cesar Chavez Jr.
content: the judges scored the fight 99-91, 97-93 and 98-92 . Paul defeated former heavyweight king Mike Tyson by unanimous decision in November . he is now riding a six-fight winning streak since losing a split decision to Tommy Fury .

title: Women's Euros A-Z: The history of the tournament in 26 facts
content: the 2025 women's european championship kicks off in Switzerland on friday . a is for ... angerer, Nadine: Switzerland's goalkeeping coach and former Germany custodian earns five euros winners' medals .

title: Who won and what questions remain after recruiting's busiest month
content: the most active month of the 2026 recruiting cycle is drawing to a close . Florida, Texas and Texas A&M led the charge among the nation's recruiting risers . Alabama, LSU and Ohio State stand among the prominent football powers poised to rise in July .

title: Thrissur infanticide: remains of babies excavated
content: Remains will be sent for DNA profiling to confirm that the babies were indeed born to the accused couple

content: Affected localities include Main Bazaar, Agraharam, New Market, Gajjala Vari Cheruvu Area, Clock Tower, Kundi Center, Nawabpeta, Vennavallivari Peta, Satyanarayanapeta, and Perugu Chettu

title: Shimla rain: Five-storey building collapses in Shimla, landslips block highways at multiple places
content: A five-storey building collapsed in Bhattakufer in the suburbs of Shimla on Monday, June 30, morning, while several cows from a shed washed away in the cloudburst in Rampur.

title: State govt. may approach court on Kalaignar University, says Higher Education Minister
content: The Governor, who has to give his consent to the Bill to establish the university, was yet to respond and attempts to get his appointment to get his consent for the Bill did not fructify, says Govi Chezhian

title: Delhi court allows CBI to close JNU student Najeeb Ahmed missing case
content: The agency filed its closure report before the court in the case after getting permission from the Delhi High Court

title: Congress chief Kharge says decision on Karnataka CM change lies with party high command
content: Congress leaders in Karnataka claims possible Chief Minister change; AICC president Kharge defers decision to party high command

title: Voters born after 1987 in Bihar do not need to produce documents for parents if latter’s names are there in 2003 Electoral Rolls: ECI
content: According to the guidelines issued by ECI, any person whose name is not recorded in the 2003 Electoral Rolls shall for establishing their eligibility to be an elector submit from amongst a wide range of eligible government documents.

title: Chennai-based association on a mission to make textbooks accessible to college students
content: The Rajasthan Youth Association, as part of its Book Bank project, has been distributing free textbooks to college students in the Chennai, Kancheepuram, Tiruvallur, and Chengalpettu districts for the past 61 years

title: Sikkim MP Indra Hang Subba submits representation to Parliamentary panel seeking restoration of flight operations at Pakyong airport
content: A statement from the MP's office said Indra Hang Subba briefed about the ongoing crisis faced by the people and tourism stakeholders in North Sikkim following repeated natural disasters

title: Kolkata gang rape: PIL in Calcutta High Court seeking transfer of probe to CBI
content: The petitioner prayed for direction to the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) to hold a preliminary inquiry into the incident as complained of by the alleged survivor and file an interim report before the court

title: Karnataka: Students see red as Kuvempu University hikes fee for PG and PhD courses
content: The university in its budget for the year 2025-26, tabled in March this year, stated that the institute was facing financial constraints and had a shortage of ₹37.26 crore to meet the expenses.

title: Teen girl sexually assaulted in Pune; three women robbed after their car stops on highway
content: Multiple teams have been formed to nab the accused, while the process of registering a case is underway, Pune (Rural) Superintendent of Police Sandip Singh Gill said.

content: Mallikarjun Kharge reacted RSS general secretary Dattatreya Hosabale's call to review the words 'socialist' and 'secular' in the Preamble.

title: Global Gateway project takes off at Sargaalaya Arts and Crafts Village in Kozhikode
content: A light-and-sound show to be set up in the village on the culture and folklore of Kadathanad is touted to be the biggest in south India. ₹95.34 crore sanctioned for project which is funded by the Union government as per the recommendations of the State government

title: YS Sharmila urges people to join Congress and help rejuvenate the party in A.P.
content: If the Congress had sufficient resources, it could rise as a major political force in the Andhra Pradesh, APCC president said

title: YSRCP urges SP to follow HC orders allowing Tadipatri former MLA to visit his home
content: YSRCP delegation submitted a representation to the SP on Monday, a day after police forcibly shifted the former MLA to Anantapur from his residence in Tadipatri

title: Indian team in Washington extends stay for trade talks: Official
content: Both countries are engaged in negotiations for an interim trade deal and are trying to finalise the pact before July 9, the deadline for the expiry of the suspensions of reciprocal tariffs

title: Four shot dead by unidentified gunmen in Manipur’s Churachandpur
content: “The ambush took place near Mongjang village at around 2 p.m. when the victims were travelling in a car,” a police officer said

title: Kerala University V-C seeks inquiry into Registrar’s conduct during Governor’s visit

title: Kerala Tourism department sanctions ₹2.2 crore for Noottavan Para project in Alappuzha

content: Drug cartel operated by Tanveer Shah, a Pakistan-based smuggler, and Joban Kaler, a Canada-based handler; nine people arrested, say Punjab Police

content: Dismissing allegations of inaction police said they registered a case against the accused after a video of the incident surfaced on social media. They added that the youth were assaulted by members of various communities and not just Muslims.

title: Jharkhand CM, Governor pay tributes to tribal warriors of Santhal rebellion on 'Hul Diwas'

title: What’s changing in Indian railways from July 1: Here’s everything you need to know

title: Ravada A. Chandrasekhar is new Kerala State Police Chief
